javax.time.calendrical

Interface DateTime.PlusAdjuster

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PeriodUnit.PeriodBetween
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Duration, Period
    Enclosing interface:
    DateTime

    public static interface DateTime.PlusAdjuster
    Strategy for adjusting a date-time object by addition.

    This interface allows different types of addition to be modeled. Implementations of this interface are used to add to a date-time.

    Implementations should not normally be used directly. Instead, the DateTime.plus(PlusAdjuster) method should be used: 

       dateTime = dateTime.plus(adjuster);

    Implementation notes

    This interface must be implemented with care to ensure other classes operate correctly. All implementations that can be instantiated must be final, immutable and thread-safe.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DateTime doPlusAdjustment(DateTime dateTime)
      Implementation of the strategy to add to the specified date-time object.

    • Method Detail

      • doPlusAdjustment

        DateTime doPlusAdjustment(DateTime dateTime)
        Implementation of the strategy to add to the specified date-time object.

        This method is not intended to be called by application code directly. Instead, the DateTime.plus(PlusAdjuster) method should be used: 

           dateTime = dateTime.plus(adjuster);

        Implementation notes

        The implementation takes the input object and adds to it. For example, the implementation Duration will add the length of the duration.

        Implementations must use the methods on DateTime to make the adjustment. The returned object must have the same observable type as this object. The input object will be mutated if it is mutable, or a new object returned if immutable.

        This interface can be used by calendar systems other than ISO. Typically this requires no extra work, because the algorithm for adding/subtraing in the calendar system is part of the DateTime implementation.

        Parameters:
        dateTime - the date-time object to adjust, not null
        Returns:
        an object of the same type with the adjustment made, not null
        Throws:
        DateTimeException - if unable to add
        ArithmeticException - if numeric overflow occurs
